summary: Partnerships and trusts can be created without naming the people who own and control them. This lack of transparency can be attractive to criminals laundering money or hiding illegal activities. The Corporate Transparency Act requires certain businesses to report ownership information to Treasury's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN). But some partnerships and trusts are not subject to this reporting requirement. As a result, illegal activities...
title: Illicit Finance: Treasury Should Monitor Partnerships and Trusts for Future Risks
